actions: Nourishes Yin, moistens the Lungs, clears Heat, stops coughing, clears the Heart and calms the Shen.

With Zhi Mu, for Lily Syndrome with irritability and mental disorientation due to Yin Deficiency or lingering Heat in the late stages of a febrile disease, dry cough and vexation and agitation after a warm disease.
With Sheng Di Huang, cools the Heart and treats both Qi and Blood to restore harmony to the Ying and Wei after a warm febrile disease.
Clears Heat, drains Fire, nourishes Yin, moistens Dryness, generates Fluids, clears Deficiency Fire and quenches thirst.
Clears Heat, cools the Blood, nourishes Yin, generates fluids and cools Heart Fire.
Spreads Liver Qi and breaks up Stagnant Qi.
Regulates Qi, adjusts the Middle, relieves the diaphragm, dries Dampness and transforms Phlegm.
With Qing Pi, for flank pain and chest and abdominal distention due to Liver Qi Stagnation.
Transforms Phlegm, reduces distention and resolves hardenings.
With Chen Pi, strengthens the Middle Jiao.
Invigorates the Blood, dissolves Phlegm and-resolves Stagnation.
Promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain.
With Qing Pi, for abdominal pain, distention and belching.
With Mu Xiang and Qing Pi, for indigestion, fullness and discomfort in the chest, epigastrium and abdomen, anorexia and belching or vomiting.

syndromes: Lily Syndrome Bai He Bing due to Liver Qi Stagnation with Liver Yin Deficiency
